column4: When i try to do "su" or open anything, i get "I/O" error. When i first tried to boot i got "cylinder is too large;not supported by BIOS" twice and the third time i tried to reboort my BIOS didn't recognize my HDD at all, 4th time it worked fine, except that I keep getting IO errors no matter what i do
also disk may be failing - check output of smartctl -H /dev/sdX
there might be a hardware problem
